alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Prairie; Pulaski (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:42PM CDT until May 15 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WOODRUFF...PRAIRIE...SOUTHERN LONOKE...EASTERN GRANT...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN SALINE...SOUTHEASTERN PULASKI AND NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS COUNTIES... At 441 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fair Oaks to near Hazen to Tull, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluff... Benton... Stuttgart... Sheridan... Brinkley... Clarendon... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... White Hall... Haskell... England... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Redfield... Altheimer... Humphrey... Tull... Fredonia... Humnoke... Keo... This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 183 and 218. Interstate 530 between mile markers 6 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
